p: Bacillus safensis crude extract showed MIC values of between 0.125 and >16 mg/mL. The crude extract showed activity against B. subtilis, M. marinum, and E. coli at concentrations of 0.125 mg/mL, 0.500 mg/mL, and 0.250 mg/mL, respectively. Crude endophytic extracts of Bacillus safensis isolated from Ophioglossum reticulatum L. displayed antibacterial activity against Staphylococcus aureus and Escherichia coli [ 69]. This is in agreement with the obtained results.
